body_html: Nvcc is usually slightly behind the latest gcc version, here http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-linux/index.html you can find supported host compilers for cuda 9. So gcc 6.x is supported (fedora 25, ubuntu 17.04), but gcc 7.x is not.
body_text: Nvcc is usually slightly behind the latest gcc version, here http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-linux/index.html you can find supported host compilers for cuda 9. So gcc 6.x is supported (fedora 25, ubuntu 17.04), but gcc 7.x is not.
body: Nvcc is usually slightly behind the latest gcc version, here http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-linux/index.html you can find supported host compilers for cuda 9. So gcc 6.x is supported (fedora 25, ubuntu 17.04), but gcc 7.x is not.
